subject: Re: [junit] JUnit testing of servlet and HTTP servlet requests
msgSnippet: ... I don t want to turn this into a J2EE good/bad war but the new version 5 is much, much better than earlier versions.  Apart from the APIs complete
messageBody:
On 08/08/07, Pat Farrell <pfarrell@...> wrote:
> I haven't done serious J2EE work in about long, either, and I'd like to
> keep it that way. The whole J2EE space is too fat, baroque, and complex
> for my tastes. YMMV.
>
> Servlets with Tomcat or Resin is much lighter and easier to understand.

I don't want to turn this into a J2EE good/bad war but the new version
5 is much, much better than earlier versions. Apart from the APIs
complete misinterpretation of what Dependency Injection is and a bit
too much XML config for my tastes, the experience has been all
positive. It's been really easy to coordinate transactions across
multiple distributed transactional resources.

--Nat
